In October, Sergio Marchionne ignited controversy when he said that Fiat would be better off if it eliminated Italy. Trade unions and politicians accused him of "blackmail" in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure. We won't have to wait 10 years to find out if he's right.

"My fear would be you don't have a guy like Eric Schmidt who keeps the trains running on time," said one former Google Inc. employee, who declined to be named for fear of reprisal. I'm having a hard time imagining( Larry) going from the role I've seen him in, to going to a CEO role, he added.
